metadata.title: [System Name] FedRAMP Security Assessment Results (SAR)

roles.title: FedRAMP Program Management Office
roles.description: The organization that prepared this SSP. If developed in-house, this is the CSP itself.

roles.title: Prepared By
roles.description: The organization that prepared this SAR.

roles.title: Prepared For
roles.description: The organization for which this SAR was prepared. Typically the CSP.

roles.title: Security Assessment Plan Approval
roles.description: The individual or individuals accountable for the accuracy of this SAR.

roles.title: Assessment Team
roles.description: The individual or individuals performing the assessment.

roles.title: Assessment Lead
roles.description: The individual leading the assessment activities.

roles.title: Penetration Test Team
roles.description: The individual or individuals performing the penetration test.

roles.title: Penetration Test Lead
roles.description: The individual leading the penetration test activities.

roles.title: Assessment Organization's Managerial POC
roles.description: The management-level POC within the assessor's organization accountable for the organization's assessment performance.

roles.title: CSP POCs During Testing
roles.description: At least three CSP testing points of contact must be identified in a FedRAMP SAP.

roles.title: CSP Operations POC
roles.description: An operations center role, such as a SOC or NOC.

roles.title: CSP's End of Testing Notification POC
roles.description: A role for an individual within the CSP to be notified by the assessor when testing is complete.

roles.title: CSP Results POCs
roles.description: A role for the individuals within the CSP who are to receive the assessment results.

locations.title: Assessor's HQ
locations.remarks: The assessor's HQ, or the address of the assessment team's primary business location.

parties.name: Assessment Organization Name
parties.remarks:
Replace sample 3PAO information.

If the assessor is A2LA Certified, include the ISO/IEC-17020

parties.name: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program: Program Management Office
parties.remarks:
This party entry must be present in a FedRAMP SAR.

The uuid may be different; however, the uuid must be associated with the \"fedramp-pmo\" role in the responsible-party assemblies.

responsible-parties.remarks:
Exactly one party

This is the assessor.

Exactly one party.

This is the UUID for the CSP in the SSP.

If no OSCAL-based SSP exists, create a CSP party in the SAP, and provide that UUID here.

Exactly one party

The party-uuid should reference a party in the SSP.

If an appropriate party does not exist in the SSP, the SAP tool should add a party to the SAP, or have the CSP add the party to the SSP..

The SAP tool should not modify the SSP.

There should be at least three CSP Assessment POCs.

At least one should be available 24x7 during assessment activities.

At least one should be an operations center, such a SOC or NOC.

The party-uuid should reference a party in the SSP or SAP.

If an appropriate party does not exist in the SSP or SAP, the SAR tool should add a party to the SAR.

The SAP tool should not modify the SSP.

metadata.remarks: This OSCAL-based FedRAMP SAR Template can be used for the FedRAMP initial or annual assessment reporting.

import-ap.remarks:
FedRAMP prefers the path for the SAP be relative to the location of this SAR file. Absolute links will not work when FedRAMP tools import the content.

This may point to a back-matter resource using a URI fragment.

activities.title: Locally Defined Activity
activities.description: This describes an activity that was not defined in the SAP, but was performed during the assessment.

inventory-items.description: A Windows laptop, which is not defined in the SSP inventory.

components.title: Assessment Laptop
components.remarks:
Ideally, this assessment laptop would have been defined in the SAP, and not repeated here.

If the laptop was not known at the time the SAP was drafted, or something different was used, it must be defined here.

assessment-platforms.title: Revised Assessment Platform

uses-components.remarks: Cites the Vulnerability Scanning Tool identified in the SAP.
Cites the XYZ Database Scanning Tool identified in the SAP.

assessment-platforms.remarks:
This is an example of a revised assessment platform.

Ideally, all assessment platforms and components are defined in the SAP. If there is a departure from what is defined in the SAP, it must be defined in the SAR.

This is a mixed example showing a revised component (a different assessment laptop defined as a component in the SAR) being paired with tools previously defined in the SAP.

control-selections.description: Include all controls in the specified in the assessment plan, except as explicitly excluded here.

parts.name: authorization-statement
parts.prose: Priority levels were established based on [describe].

parts.name: authorization-statement
parts.prose: Notes and other information the assessor may wish to provide related to a continued authorization recommendation.

parts.name: authorization-statement
parts.prose: [3PAO Name] attests that the SAR from the [system name] [initial | annual] assessment testing provides a complete assessment of the applicable FedRAMP controls as stipulated in the SAP. Evidence to validate the successful implementation of the various security controls has been collected and validated. Based on the remaining risks, and continuous improvements of security related processes and controls, [3PAO Name] recommends a continued authorization be granted for the [system name].

entries.title: Send Final Version of SAR to CSP and ISSO

observations.title: [EXAMPLE]Examine AC Policy
observations.description: [EXAMPLE]The AC policy existed, and had all the required elements.

subjects.title: Reviewed Policy
subjects.remarks: If the policy is defined in the SSP as a component, you can cite it using `subject`, and use the UUID of the policy component in the SSP.

relevant-evidence.remarks: If the policy is *not* an SSP component, it should be attached to the SAR as a `resource`, and cited here as a URI fragment.

observations.remarks:
The subject-reference identifies a policy that was reviewed and is attached in the back-matter.

The observation source is linked to the task in the schedule associated with performing document reviews.

Even though the policy may be defined in the SSP and OSCAL would allow the SAR to reference it, FedRAMP requires the assessor attach all evidence to the SAR..

observations.title: [EXAMPLE]AC Policy Interview
observations.description: [EXAMPLE]The person interviewed knew about the policy and where to find it.

relevant-evidence.description:
This describes the evidence, and adds relevant detail.

For example, this could cite where to find this information in interview notes.
relevant-evidence.remarks:
The subject-reference is linked to the person interviewed.

The observation source is linked to the task in the schedule associated with performing staff interviews.

The relevant-evidence is linked to the interview notes.

These may be defined in the SSP, SAP, or SAR. Tools should check all three locations.

relevant-evidence.description: Raw scanner tool output - discovery scan.

observations.remarks:
Undocumented hosts are entered into the SAR's result/local-definitions section as inventory-items or components.

Undocumented hosts are listed in the observations assembly as subject-references.

The origin must contain the UUID of the tool used to perform the scan.

relevant-evidence.description: Raw scanner tool output - Infrastructure and OS Scan.

observations.title: Operational Requirement
observations.description: Provide the justification for the operational requirement.

relevant-evidence.description: A screen shot showing the system impact when patch is applied.
Vendor detail describing why this happens.
A screen shot showing the setting is correct
Vendor detail describing why this happens.

observations.title: Risk Adjustment
observations.description: Describe the risk adjustment justification here.

relevant-evidence.description: Describe the risk adjustment evidence here.
relevant-evidence.remarks:
Attach relevant evidence as a `resource`.

Use a `link` field with a URI fragment to link to the resource using its UUID.

observations.description:
[EXAMPLE]Spear phishing test yielded a 22% click rate.

[EXAMPLE]The target threshold was below 20%.
The policy describes a procedure, which could not be found.
observations.remarks:
The `type` field designates this observations as an issue with a statement in the SSP. Tools can filter on this field to summarize all SSP issues.

The `origin` identifies the assessor who found the SSP statement issue.

If relevant, evidence can be cited as well using the `relevant-evidence` assembly, such as a screenshot showing a setting is different than stated in the SSP.

risks.title: Risk Title
risks.description:
This is a description of the identified risk.

TCW: Identified Risk.

Scans: Vulnerability Description.

Pen Test: Risk Description.

RET: Description.
risks.statement:
This is a statement about the identified risk.

TCW: Risk Statement..

Scans: N/A.

Pen Risk Statement.

RET: Risk Statement.

remediations.title: Remediation Title
remediations.description:
A description of the recommended remediation.

TCW: Assessor's recommended remediation (lifecycle=\"recommendation\").

Scans: Tool's recommended remediation (lifecycle=\"recommendation\")

Pen Test: Assessor's recommended remediation (lifecycle=\"recommendation\")

RET: Assessor's recommended remediation (lifecycle=\"recommendation\").

POA&M: CSP's intended remediation (no type flag).

risks.title: Risk Title
risks.description:
This is a description of the identified risk.

TCW: Identified Risk.

Scans: Vulnerability Description.

Pen Test: Risk Description.

RET: Description.
risks.statement:
This is a statement about the identified risk.

TCW: Risk Statement..

Scans: N/A.

Pen Risk Statement.

RET: Risk Statement.

remediations.description:
A description of the recommended remediation.

TCW: Assessor's recommended remediation (lifecycle=\"recommendation\").

Scans: Tool's recommended remediation (lifecycle=\"recommendation\")

Pen Test: Assessor's recommended remediation (lifecycle=\"recommendation\")

RET: Assessor's recommended remediation (lifecycle=\"recommendation\").

POA&M: CSP's intended remediation (no type flag).

risks.title: Vulnerability Title
risks.description: This is a description of the vulnerability provided by the tool.
risks.statement:
This is a statement about the identified risk as provided by the tool.

This field must be present, but may be blank (or state 'No Risk Statement' if no statement is provided by the tool.

mitigating-factors.description: Describe why the cited implementation statement justifies lowering the risk.

remediations.title: Tool's Recommendation
remediations.description: A description of the recommended remediation as provided by the tool.
remediations.remarks:
Recommended and planned remediation entries should remain when the risk is closed.

Simply add the closure-actions field and change the risk-status to \"closed\".

remediations.title: Assessor's Recommendation
remediations.description: A description of the recommended remediation as provided by the assessor.
remediations.remarks:
The assessor may add their recommendation in addition to the tool's recommendation, or if no tool recommendation is provided.

The assessor should leave the tool recommendation, even if adding their own.

Recommended and planned remediation entries should remain when the risk is closed.

Simply add the closure-actions field and change the risk-status to \"closed\".

entries.title: Closed
entries.description:
Describe what action(s) the CSP took to close the risk.

[EXAMPLE]Applied patch. Vulnerability no longer found in subsequent scan.

risks.title: Risk Title
risks.description: This is a description of the issue found by the penetration testing team.
risks.statement: This is a statement about the risk identified by penetration testing.

remediations.title: Assessor's Recommendation
remediations.description: A description of the recommended remediation as provided by the assessor.
remediations.remarks: The assessor may add their recommendation.

findings.title: [EXAMPLE]TCW Objective AC-1(a)(1)[1] (Examine)
findings.description: An overall statement about the system's satisfaction of this objective.
findings.remarks:
There should be at least one `related-observation` for each test method. There may be more than one.

This objective only has one method (Examine), so there should be at least one `related-objservation`.

findings.title: [EXAMPLE]TCW Objective AC-1(a)(1)[2] (Examine)
findings.description: An overall statement about the system's satisfaction of this objective.
findings.remarks:
There should be at least one `related-observation` for each test method. There may be more than one.

This objective only has one method (Examine), so there should be at least one `related-objservation`.

findings.title: [EXAMPLE]TCW Objective AC-1(a)(1)[3] (Examine and Interview)
findings.description: An overall statement about the system's satisfaction of this objective.
findings.remarks:
There should be at least one `related-observation` for each test method. There may be more than one.

This objective has two methods (Examine and Interview), so there should be at least two `related-objservation`, including at least one observaton of each type.

findings.title: [EXAMPLE]Issue With AU-1 Statement
findings.description: [EXAMPLE]There is an issue with an SSP Statement.
findings.remarks:
The `implementation-statement-uuid` contains the UUID of the erroneous statement in the SSP.

The `related-observation` contains the UUID of an observation with details about the issue, including a statement and any relevant evidence.

findings.title: Discovery Scan Results
findings.description: The results of the discovery scan.
findings.remarks: The UUID for the tool operator must be listed as the party-uuid for the finding. There may be more than one.

findings.title: [EXAMPLE]Infrastructure Scan Unique Vulnerability
findings.description: An example set of infrastructure scan findings.

findings.title: [EXAMPLE]Spear Phishing Results
findings.description: The Results of the spear phishing test.
findings.remarks: When reporting a result for a test such as the spear phishing activity, a risk assembly is required if the result is to be reported in the Risk Exposure Table.

findings.title: [EXAMPLE]Penetration Test Result
findings.description: A finding from penetration testing activities.
findings.remarks:
If a penetration test result is favorable, such as to say the SOC detected the activities appropriately, no risk is required.

If a penetration test result identifies a vulnerability or deficiency, the risk assembly is required.

observations.title: [EXAMPLE]
observations.description: [EXAMPLE]This is the contents of the Observations and Evidence cell in the TCW.

resources.title: [EXAMPLE]Interview Notes
resources.remarks:
A tool could use either an rlink or base64 field.

If both are present, FedRAMP tools will give preference to the base64 content.

There may be more than one rlink.

If there is no base64 field, at lest one of the rlink fields must include a relative path.

resources.title: [EXAMPLE]AC Policy
resources.remarks:
A tool could use either an rlink or base64 field.

If both are present, FedRAMP tools will give preference to the base64 content.

There may be more than one rlink.

If there is no base64 field, at lest one of the rlink fields must include a relative path.

resources.title: [EXAMPLE]Screen Shot
resources.remarks:
A tool could use either an rlink or base64 field.

If both are present, FedRAMP tools will give preference to the base64 content.

There may be more than one rlink.

If there is no base64 field, at lest one of the rlink fields must include a relative path.

resources.title: [EXAMPLE]Raw Scan Results - Discovery Scan
resources.description: Raw scan results exported from the scanning tool.
resources.remarks:
A SAR tool could use either an rlink or base64 field.

If both are present, FedRAMP tools will give preference to the base64 content.

There may be more than one rlink.

If there is no base64 field, at lest one of the rlink fields must include a relative path.

resources.title: [EXAMPLE]Raw Scan Results - OS and Inf Scans
resources.description: Raw scan results exported from the scanning tool.
resources.remarks:
A SAR tool could use either an rlink or base64 field.

If both are present, FedRAMP tools will give preference to the base64 content.

There may be more than one rlink.

If there is no base64 field, at lest one of the rlink fields must include a relative path.

resources.title: Penetration Test Report
resources.remarks:
A SAR tool could use either an rlink or base64 field.

If both are present, FedRAMP tools will give preference to the base64 content.

There may be more than one rlink.

If there is no base64 field, at lest one of the rlink fields must include a relative path.

FedRAMP is formulating guidelines for handling digital/electronic signatures in OSCAL, and welcome feedback on solutions.

For now, FedRAMP recommends one of the following:

* Render the OSCAL SAR content as a PDF that is digitally signed and attached.
* Render the OSCAL SAR content as printed pages that are physically signed, scanned, and attached.


If your organization prefers another approach, please seek prior approval from the FedRAMP PMO.

resources.title: FedRAMP Applicable Laws and Regulations
resources.remarks: Must be present in a FedRAMP SSP.
